channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Smart Companies Detect Threats Before They Hit
item.description: The organizations that consistently navigate turbulence aren’t lucky. They’re listening.

item.title: Apple is experiencing its biggest leadership shakeup since Steve Jobs died
item.description: The exodus of top talent spans critical divisions from AI to design, legal affairs, environmental policy, and operations.

item.title: Hiring? Research Says Using ‘Years of Experience’ is a Terrible Way to Select the Best Candidate
item.description: And so is including ‘years of experience’ in your job posting.

item.title: The 2026 FIFA World Cup draw has arrived to D.C. What to know, from process to scheduled VIPs
item.description: FIFA has invited more teams than ever for a World Cup priced largely for fans in the 1%. The process of figuring out which teams in the expanded 48-na...

item.title: You’ll be Managing Digital Employees in 2026, a New Forecast Says
item.description: Agent AIs are getting useful enough to be counted alongside human workers, and that’ll change how you manage your business.

item.title: Employees Call Workplace Nepotism ‘Widespread’ and Damaging to Morale
item.description: New survey data shows a majority of workers say family relationships influence many hiring and promotion decisions, creating threats to staff cohesion...

item.title: Everyone wants to eat Nvidia’s lunch
item.description: So far, Nvidia has provided the vast majority of the processors used to train and operate large AI models like the ones that underpin ChatGPT. Tech co...

item.title: Elon Musk and Bill Gates warn that AI will kill all jobs within 20 years. ‘That’s not what we’re seeing,’ LinkedIn exec says
item.description: Elon Musk may predict a jobless future, but LinkedIn’s latest hiring data shows demand rising, not collapsing. That will be music to Gen Z's ears.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott is trying to close the DEI gap in higher ed, with $155 million in donations this week alone
item.description: These gifts are a “major source of encouragement” during uncertain times for higher education.

item.title: Netflix’s bombshell deal to buy Warner Bros. brings Batman and Harry Potter to the big red streamer and infuriates theater owners and the Ellisons
item.description: Just days before Netflix emerged as the highest bidder, Paramount tore into the "myopic process" that had become "tainted."

item.title: Block insiders talk about how Jack Dorsey turned Square into a multidimensional financial services giant
item.description: On November 19, Block Inc. held its first Investor Day in three years. Jack Dorsey, the company’s cofounder, chief executive, and “Block Head,” took t...

item.title: Netflix stock sinks as the streaming giant reveals plans to buy Warner Bros. and HBO in $83 billion megadeal
item.description: Netflix has announced that it intends to buy legendary Hollywood studio Warner Bros. in a deal valued at approximately $82.7 billion. The deal, which ...

item.title: How Indiana State Employees Got to Bring Their Newborns to Work
item.description: Hoosier Governor Mike Braun launched a policy allowing employees of selected state agencies to bring newborns until they are six months old, with plan...

item.title: Cloudflare says it’s investigating the outage that brought down Zoom and LinkedIn
item.description: Internet infrastructure company Cloudflare on Friday said it was investigating an outage that took place in the morning that brought down several glob...

item.title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos credits a video store job for launching his career—and cherishes this lesson from Tony Bennett
item.description: "It was an MBA course and film school all wrapped up into one for me," he said.
